import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.97be749e:
def get_valuation(dataset,index):
    #Calling the dataset from Quandl
    mydata_final = quandl.get(dataset['Code'][index])
    #Initiate dummy value
    counter = 100
    mydata_final.loc[mydata_final.index[0],'Value'] = 100*(1+mydata_final.loc[mydata_final.index[0],'Returns']/100)

    for i in range(len(mydata_final)):
        counter *= (1+ mydata_final.loc[mydata_final.index[i],'Returns']/100 )
        mydata_final.loc[mydata_final.index[i],'Value'] = counter
    
    return mydata_final
source.1d4a3d5e:
def performance_table_year(table,dataset,index):
    year_output = [table['Title'][index]]
    for year in [1,3,5,10]:
        performance_data = dataset.iloc[-12*year:]
        start, end = performance_data.iloc[0], performance_data.iloc[-1]
        year_output.append(round((100*(end-start)/start).Value/year,2))
    return year_output

performance_table_year(eureka_hedge_islamic_data,get_valuation(eureka_hedge_islamic_data,2),2)
source.6f99fe22:
from tqdm import tqdm

def table_1y_10y_performance(dataset):
    return_tables = pd.DataFrame()
    for i in tqdm(range(len(dataset))):
        return_tables[i] = performance_table_year(dataset,get_valuation(dataset,i),i)
    return_table = return_tables.transpose()
    return_table.columns = ['Index Type','1Yr','3Yr','5Yr','10Yr']
    return return_table

performance_islamic = table_1y_10y_performance(eureka_hedge_islamic_data)
performance_islamic
source.3ca06ce8:
index = 2
mydata = get_valuation(eureka_hedge_islamic_data,index)

import plotly.graph_objs as go
from plotly.subplots import make_subplots

fig = make_subplots(rows=2, cols=1,shared_xaxes=True,vertical_spacing=0.02)

fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=mydata.index, y=mydata['Returns']),row=1,col=1)
fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=mydata.index, y=mydata['Value']),row=2,col=1)

fig.update_xaxes(title_text="Date", row=2, col=1)

fig.update_yaxes(title_text="MoM Return", row=1, col=1)
fig.update_yaxes(title_text="Value", row=2, col=1)

fig.update_layout(title= eureka_hedge_islamic_data['Title'][index])
